intro: Senecio sedifoleus, commonly known as the woolly blueweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Senecio sedifoleus is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
